thunder 0.0.1101

Calculate convective indices

Source: R/sounding_compute.R
sounding_compute.Rd

Function calculates presently over 100 atmospheric thermal-, kinematic- and composite indices (e.g. CAPE, CIN, Lapse Rates, EHI, STP, SCP, etc...) related mostly to severe weather phenomena (Thunderstorms, Large Hail, Tornadoes, etc...)

sounding_compute(
  pressure,
  altitude,
  temp,
  dpt,
  wd,
  ws,
  export_profile = 0,
  accuracy = 1
)

Arguments

pressure

pressure [hPa]
altitude

altitude [metres]
temp

air temperature [degree Celsius]
dpt

dew point temperature [degree Celsius]
wd

wind direction [degrees]
ws

wind speed [knots or m/s - TODO/TODISCUSS]
export_profile

whether to export interpolated levels for drawing on Skew-T diagram. Binary [0 - default, no extra data for drawing exported, 1 - extracting data to be used ]
accuracy

how accurately integrate the positive/negative area. Valid options (1 - fast implementation (default), 2 - medium accuracy, 3 - very accurate)

Details

Wrapper for a generic C++ based function. Please consider using a slightly faster `?sounding_default()` for computing large databases (i.e. at least over 1,000,000 soundings).

Examples

pressure <- c(1000, 855, 700, 500, 300, 100, 10)
altitude <- c(0, 1500, 2500, 6000, 8500, 12000, 25000)
temp <- c(25, 10, 0, -15, -30, -50, -92)
dpt <- c(20, 5, -5, -30, -55, -80, -99)
wd <- c(0, 90, 135, 180, 270, 350, 0)
ws <- c(5, 10, 20, 30, 40, 5, 0)
options(scipen = 999) # change formatting
sounding_compute(pressure, altitude, temp, dpt, wd, ws)
